IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: CHAMINADE UNIVERSITY OFFERS ITS STUDENTS AN EDUCATION IN A COLLABORATIVE LEARNING ENVIRONMENT.
IRS990.MissionDesc: CHAMINADE UNIVERSITY OFFERS ITS STUDENTS AN EDUCATION IN A COLLABORATIVE LEARNING ENVIRONMENT THAT PREPARES THEM FOR LIFE, WORK AND SERVICE. GUIDED BY ITS CATHOLIC, MARIANIST AND LIBERAL ARTS EDUCATIONAL TRADITIONS, CHAMINADE ENCOURAGES THE (SEE SCHEDULE O) DEVELOPMENT OF MORAL CHARACTER AND PERSONAL COMPETENCIES, AND THE COMMITMENT TO BUILD A JUST AND PEACEFUL SOCIETY. THE UNIVERSITY OFFERS THE CIVIC AND CHURCH COMMUNITIES OF THE PACIFIC REGION ITS ACADEMIC AND INTELLECTUAL RESOURCES IN THE PURSUIT OF COMMON AIMS.
IRS990.Desc: CHAMINADE OFFERS AN EDUCATION IN A COLLABORATIVE LEARNING ENVIRONMENT THAT PREPARES STUDENTS FOR LIFE, SERVICE AND SUCCESSFUL CAREERS. GUIDED BY ITS CATHOLIC, MARIANIST AND LIBERAL ARTS EDUCATIONAL TRADITIONS AND ACCREDITED BY THE WASC SENIOR COLLEGE AND UNIVERSITY COMMISSION, CHAMINADE PROVIDES 2800 STUDENTS WITH 23 UNDERGRADUATE DEGREE PROGRAMS, 8 GRADUATE DEGREE PROGRAMS AND 15 DEGREE OPPORTUNITIES FOR WORKING ADULTS IN PROFESSIONAL AND CONTINUING EDUCATION (PACE).

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: AUXILIARY ENTERPRISES AT CHAMINADE INCLUDE A 400 STUDENT RESIDENCE HALL PROGRAM; DINING SERVICES FEATURING THE SILVERSWORD CAFE AND COURTYARD POD MARKET; NCAA PACIFIC WEST CONFERENCE DIVISION II ATHLETIC PROGRAM ANNUALLY HOSTING THE EA SPORTS MAUI INVITATIONAL BASKETBALL TOURNAMENT; CAMPUS BOOKSTORE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: IN FYE JUNE 30, 2011, THE ORGANIZATION PURCHASED A FINE ART EDITION OF THE ST. JOHN'S BIBLE. THE BIBLE IS A WORK OF ART AND A WORK OF THEOLOGY. THE VISION AND VALUES OF THE BIBLE ARE TO IGNITE IMAGINATION, GLORIFY GOD'S WORD, REVIVE TRADITION, DISCOVER HISTORY, FOSTER THE ARTS, AND GIVE VOICE. THE ST. JOHN'S BIBLE, ON PUBLIC EXHIBITION, PROVIDES EDUCATION TO STUDENTS BY PROVIDING OPPORTUNITIES TO EXPLORE THE VARIOUS SUBJECTS WRITTEN AND ILLUMINATED IN THE BIBLE. CHAMINADE PLANS TO USE THE BIBLE IN LITURGIES MARKING EVENTS OF GREATEST SIGNIFICANCE IN CAMPUS LIFE, SUCH AS GRADUATIONS AND INSTALLATIONS. CHAMINADE WILL ALSO MAKE IT AVAILABLE FOR USE BY THE DIOCESE OF HONOLULU FOR SIMILAR OCCASIONS, SUCH AS THE ANNUAL RED MASS FOR HAWAII'S POLITICAL LEADERS AND THE OPENING OF THE ACADEMIC YEAR MASS WITH THE CATHOLIC SCHOOL TEACHERS.
ENDOWMENT FUNDS ARE USED FOR SCHOLARSHIPS AND PROGRAM EXPENSES.

THE UNIVERSITY HAS EVALUATED ITS TAX POSITIONS AND DETERMINED THAT THERE WERE NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS AT JUNE 30, 2014 AND 2013. INTEREST AND PENALTIES, IF ANY (NONE IN 2014 OR 2013), ARE INCLUDED IN INSTITUTIONAL SUPPORT EXPENSES. AS OF JUNE 30, 2014, THE YEARS THAT REMAIN SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION BY TAXING AUTHORITIES ARE 2011 AND THEREAFTER.
CHANGE IN NET ASSETS OF CUEF 154,798.
TUITION DISCOUNTS & SCHOLARSHIPS 10,429,242. FEDERAL GRANTS 4,058,388. RENTAL EXPENSES -54,000. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES -58,353. COGS -898,084.
FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 58,353. COGS 898,084. RENTAL EXPENSES 54,000.
TUITION DISCOUNTS & SCHOLARSHIPS 10,429,242. FEDERAL GRANTS NETTED AGAINST REVENUE 4,058,388.
"NOTICE OF NONDISCRIMINATORY POLICY" IS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC VIA THE UNIVERSITY CATALOG, STUDENT HANDBOOK AND CHAMINADE WEBSITE (WWW.CHAMINADE.EDU)
THE ORGANIZATION RECEIVES VARIOUS FEDERAL GOVERNMENT GRANTS SUCH AS THE PELL GRANT, TEACH GRANT, AND SUPPLEMENTAL EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITY GRANT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL PROVIDES GRANTS IN THE FORM OF CREDITS AGAINST TUITION INVOICES. GRANT FUNDS ARE NOT ACTUALLY DISBURSED FROM THE SCHOOL.

THE EXEMPT ORGANIZATION PAYS FOR HEALTH OR SOCIAL CLUB DUES ON BEHALF OF PERSONS LISTED ON FORM 990, PART VII, SECTION A, LINE 1A. AMOUNTS PAID ARE TO FACILITATE BUSINESS ACTIVITIES CONDUCTED BY SUCH PERSONS AT THE CLUB. CLUB DUES ARE PAID ON BEHALF OF BRO. BERNARD J. PLOEGER, JOHN WEBSTER AND DIANE PETERS-NGUYEN. AS ALL DUES PAID ARE TO FACILITATE BUSINESS ACTIVITIES, THE CLUB DUES QUALIFY AS WORKING CONDITION FRINGE BENEFITS AND ARE NOT REQUIRED TO BE TREATED AS TAXABLE COMPENSATION.

THE EXEMPT ORGANIZATION DOES NOT FOLLOW A WRITTEN POLICY SPECIFICALLY FOR HEALTH OR SOCIAL CLUB DUES. HOWEVER, WRITTEN DOCUMENTATION IS REQUIRED FOR ALL CHARGES INCURRED ON THE MONTHLY DUES STATEMENTS. ADDITIONALLY, ALL REIMBURSEMENTS ARE PAID DIRECTLY TO THE CLUB.
ISSUER NAME: CHAMINADE UNIVERSITY OF HONOLULU DATE THE REBATE COMPUTATION WAS PERFORMED: 01/31/2014
QUESTIONS 4D-4E AND 5D ARE NOT APPLICABLE TO THE EXEMPT ORGANIZATION. AS SUCH, THEY HAVE BEEN MARKED NO.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DANIEL J. CURRAN AND REV. JOHN A. MCGRATH: BUSINESS RELATIONSHIP

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CHAMINADE'S MEMBERS CONSIST OF THE PROVINCIAL OF THE MARIANIST PROVINCE OF THE UNITED STATES AND THE OTHER MEMBERS OF THE PROVINCIAL COUNCIL OF THE MARIANIST PROVINCE OF THE UNITED STATES. THE MEMBERS HAVE THE AUTHORITY TO ELECT MEMBERS OF CHAMINADE'S GOVERNING BODY AND APPROVE SIGNIFICANT DECISIONS OF THE GOVERNING BODY, AMONG OTHER SIMILAR POWERS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MEMBERS OF CHAMINADE HAVE THE AUTHORITY TO RATIFY NOMINEES FOR THE POSITION OF PRESIDENT OF CHAMINADE UNIVERSITY OF HONOLULU AND TO RATIFY NOMINEES FOR THE BOARD OF REGENTS AT ANY ANNUAL OR SPECIAL MEETING OF MEMBERS NOTICED FOR THE ELECTION OF REGENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MEMBERS OF CHAMINADE HAVE THE AUTHORITY TO: (A) APPROVE THE MERGER OR CONSOLIDATION OF CHAMINADE WITH ANOTHER CORPORATION OR ENTITY; (B) APPROVE THE SALE, LEASE, EXCHANGE, OR OTHER DISPOSITION OF ALL, OR SUBSTANTIALLY ALL, OF THE ASSETS OF CHAMINADE, OTHER THAN IN THE USUAL AND REGULAR COURSE OF ITS BUSINESS; (C) APPROVE THE PARTIAL OR TOTAL DISSOLUTION OF CHAMINADE; (D) AMEND CHAMINADE'S ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION PURSUANT TO THE PROCEDURES SET FORTH BY STATUTE; (E) RATIFY NOMINEES FOR THE POSITION OF PRESIDENT OF CHAMINADE UNIVERSITY OF HONOLULU; (F) RATIFY NOMINEES FOR THE BOARD OF REGENTS OF CHAMINADE AT ANY ANNUAL OR SPECIAL MEETING OF MEMBERS NOTICED FOR THE ELECTION OF REGENTS; AND (G) REMOVE A REGENT, WITH OR WITHOUT CAUSE, AT ANY ANNUAL OR SPECIAL MEETING OF THE MEMBERS NOTICED FOR THE REMOVAL OF THE REGENTS, PROVIDED, HOWEVER ANY VACANCIES MAY BE FILLED BY THE BOARD OF REGENTS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE BYLAWS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A DRAFT OF THE 990 WILL BE SUBMITTED TO ALL MEMBERS OF THE AUDIT COMMITTEE AT THEIR APRIL 2015 MEETING FOR REVIEW PRIOR TO FINALIZATION & FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EACH YEAR, IN JULY/AUGUST, THE PRESIDENT'S OFFICE EMAILS THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST FORMS TO EACH CURRENT MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF REGENTS, PRESIDENT LEADERSHIP COUNCIL AND PROVOST CABINETS. FORMS ARE THEN SENT BACK TO THE PRESIDENT'S OFFICE, WHO REVIEWS THE COMPLETED FORMS AND TRACKS WHICH FORMS MAY STILL BE OUTSTANDING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FOR THE ORGANIZATION'S PRESIDENT, THE BOARD NEGOTIATES THE CONTRACT IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE UNIVERSITY LEGAL COUNSEL. FOR OTHER OFFICERS OR KEY EMPLOYEES, COMPENSATION IS NEGOTIATED BY THE PRESIDENT OF THE UNIVERSITY WHO CONSULTS WITH THE PERSONNEL OFFICE & COMPARES COMPENSATION WITH PEER INSTITUTIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS & CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST. THE ORGANIZATION'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE ON THE ORGANIZATION'S WEBSITE & UPON REQUEST.
ALLISON PAYNTER, EX-OFFICIO, IS COMPENSATED AS A FACULTY MEMBER AND NOT AS A BOARD MEMBER.

DURING THE FISCAL YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2012, CHAMINADE UNIVERSITY ENTERED INTO A LONG-TERM POWER PURCHASE AGREEMENT TO PURCHASE THE ENERGY GENERATED BY A SOLAR ELECTRIC GENERATING FACILITY. MANAGEMENT HAS RECOGNIZED A CAPITAL LEASE FOR THE ESTIMATED PAYMENTS RELATED TO THE SYSTEM. ALTHOUGH FOR TAX PURPOSES THE AGREEMENT WOULD NOT FALL UNDER THE DEFINITION OF A CAPITAL LEASE, THE POWER PURCHASE AGREEMENT WILL BE ACCOUNTED FOR AS A CAPITAL LEASE ON THE FORM 990 IN KEEPING WITH THE BOOKS AND RECORDS OF THE ORGANIZATION.
CHANGE IN NET ASSETS OF CUEF 154,798.
THE OVERSIGHT & SELECTION PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
